column4: Hey can anyone help me to set amaroK to do something when I put in a CD?
I don't think that itunes works in wine because its dependent on quick time
How do I set amarok to play a CD when I insert a CD into my optical drive? I tried replacing sound-juicer with amarok in the removeable drives/media thing, but that didn't work
you'll probably have better luck asking in #kubuntu
I'm using gnome though...
amarok is kde and they probably all use it ;)
won't set up change though between gnome and KDE?
you probably need to find the right command line options to pass to amarok
yeah I was basically asking if anyone knew... I guess I'm gonna go for google then :)
ok, thanks
do ls Music/*/*/.* first to test
or use rm -i
asks for confirmation for every file
where did you add it, gnome sessions?
I guess, if thats the sessions option in system>preferences
yeah, hmm that's strange
is there a way to make it start absolutely last or something?
I don't think you can specify order, but your tray should be up by that point
yeah, its weird, especially since it works perfectly fine when I start it up on my own after
I have a command for you
find ./ -type f -name '.*' -delete
or replace ./ with whatever the base directory is
ok, I'll try that
probably c++ (and out of those only php is a language :) )
